intro: Lopezia foliosa, commonly known as the leafy Lopezia, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several narrow, linear segments. It produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Lopezia foliosa is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep root systems that help it survive in nutrient-poor soils.
